item.title: Shutterstockは、2022年に英CMAがMetaの買収を阻止した後、MetaからGiphyを現金$53Mで買収する予定、Metaは引き続きGiphyコンテンツにアクセスできる（Yuvraj Malik/Reuters)
item.description:
Yuvraj Malik / Reuters:
Shutterstock plans to acquire Giphy from Meta for $53M in cash, after the UK CMA blocked Meta's acquisition in 2022; Meta can still access Giphy content  —  Stock photos repository Shutterstock Inc (SSTK.N) said on Tuesday it would buy animated-images platform Giphy Inc from Meta Platforms Inc (META.O) for $53 million in cash.

item.title: ニールセン：5月15日から5月19日までのCNNの1日平均視聴者数は429Kで、2015年6月以来最低の週となり、Fox Newsは主要デモの視聴率が2001年9月以来最悪となった（Justin Baragona/The Daily Beast）。
item.description:
Justin Baragona / The Daily Beast:
Nielsen: from May 15 to May 19, CNN averaged 429K daily viewers, its lowest week since June 2015; Fox News had its worst key demo ratings since September 2001  —  This reporting is featured in this week's edition of Confider, The Daily Beast's media newsletter.  Subscribe here and send your questions, tips, and complaints here.

item.title: 音楽収入が低迷するなか、レコード会社は、米国の基本プランの価格を一度も変えていないスポティファイに、アップルやアマゾンなどに続いて値上げを迫るかもしれない（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg)
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
As music revenue slows, record labels may force Spotify, which has never changed its US base plan's price, to follow Apple, Amazon, and others in raising prices  —  Good evening from Cannes, where I saw a three-hour Argentine heist movie, a Pedro Almodovar short starring Ethan Hawke and Pedro Pascal, and Martin Scorsese's latest.

item.title: ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナルがMr.、Ms.、Mx.などの敬称を削除し、ニューヨーク・タイムズが最も顕著な生き残りとして残ったことを考察する（Anne Branigin/Washington Post）
item.description:
Anne Branigin / Washington Post:
A look at The Wall Street Journal's decision to drop courtesy titles like Mr., Ms., and Mx., leaving The New York Times as the most notable holdout remaining  —  The Wall Street Journal is the latest newspaper to drop titles such as “Mr.,” “Ms.” and “Mx.”  —  The Wall Street Journal has gone …

item.title: Max、より高価格なティアを導入：月額20ドルのUltimate Ad-Freeは、4つの同時ストリーム、100のオフラインダウンロード、1,000以上の4K UHD映画や番組を提供する（Todd Spangler/Variety)
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Max introduces a higher-priced tier: Ultimate Ad-Free for $20/month, offering four concurrent streams, 100 offline downloads, and 1,000+ 4K UHD films and shows  —  With HBO Max turning into Max, Warner Bros. Discovery is introducing a higher-priced plan — $19.99 per month …

item.title: ファイリングしている：E・ジーン・キャロル、ドナルド・トランプに対する2019年の名誉毀損訴訟の修正を求め、CNNのタウンホールでの発言に対して「非常に相当な」金額を求める（Benjamin Weiser/New York Times）。
item.description:
Benjamin Weiser / New York Times:
Filing: E. Jean Carroll asks to amend her 2019 defamation lawsuit against Donald Trump, seeking a “very substantial” amount for his comments at CNN's town hall  —  The former president's repeated denials that he sexually abused Ms. Carroll “show the depth of his malice” and merit heavy damages, her lawyer wrote.

item.title: TegnaはStandard Generalによる買収の契約が終了したと発表、Standard Generalは2022年2月にTegnaを買収することで合意、買収額は〜86億ドル（Matthew Keys/The Desk）となった。
item.description:
Matthew Keys / The Desk:
Tegna says its deal to be acquired by Standard General has been terminated; Standard General agreed to acquire Tegna in February 2022 in a deal valued at ~$8.6B  —  Television broadcaster TEGNA says its pending deal to be acquired by Standard General is officially dead.

item.title: パラマウントは、米国で6月27日に「Paramount+ with Showtime」サービスを月額11.99ドルで開始する予定、ShowtimeなしのParamount+は月額5.99ドル（ピーター・ホワイト/Deadline）。
item.description:
Peter White / Deadline:
Paramount plans to launch its Paramount+ with Showtime service in the US on June 27 for $11.99 per month; Paramount+ without Showtime will cost $5.99 per month  —  Paramount has confirmed the launch plans, including date, for the merged Paramount+ with Showtime service.

item.title: TikTok、アプリを禁止する意図の新法についてモンタナ州を提訴、修正第1条、国家安全保障問題に関する州の権限不足などを理由に（Bobby Allyn/NPR)
item.description:
Bobby Allyn / NPR:
TikTok sues Montana over its new law intending to ban the app, citing the First Amendment, the state's lack of authority on national security issues, and more  —  TikTok has filed a federal lawsuit against Montana after the state passed a law last week intended to ban the app from being downloaded within its borders.

item.title: 判事をアンタッチャブルな存在として取り上げ、倫理的な過失などの問題を無視する最高裁の報道陣に対する批判と、そのビートを改善するための提案（Dahlia Lithwick/Slate)
item.description:
Dahlia Lithwick / Slate:
A critique of the Supreme Court press corps, which covers justices as untouchable and ignores issues like ethical lapses, and suggestions for improving the beat  —  This is a part of Disorder in the Court, a weeklong series on the legal press and the most explosive Supreme Court in generations …

item.title: ブルーチェックのツイッターアカウントの中には、ブルームバーグになりすましたものもあり、AIが生成したペンタゴンの爆発画像を拡散、株式市場は一時的に下落した（Chloe Xiang/VICE）
item.description:
Chloe Xiang / VICE:
Some blue-check Twitter accounts, one pretending to be Bloomberg, spread an AI-generated image of an explosion at the Pentagon; the stock market briefly dipped  —  An AI-generated image of a fake explosion near the Pentagon went viral thanks to blue-check Twitter accounts.  —  Chloe Xiang

item.title: バイデンは、ベテラン政府弁護士のアンナ・ゴメスをFCC委員に指名し、民主党のジェフリー・スタークスと共和党のブレンダン・カーをFCCの新任務に指名する（Alex Weprin/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
Biden nominates veteran government lawyer Anna Gomez as FCC Commissioner, and nominates Democrat Geoffrey Starks and Republican Brendan Carr for new FCC terms  —  The White House also nominated Democrat Geoffrey Starks and Republican Brendan Carr for new terms on the Commission.

item.title: CinedigmがCineverseとしてリブランディングし、昨年秋に開始したその名の通りのストリーミングサービスは、22K以上のタイトルを持つ世界第6位のストリーマーだと言う（Dade Hayes/Deadline）
item.description:
Dade Hayes / Deadline:
Cinedigm rebrands as Cineverse, and says its namesake streaming service that launched last fall is the sixth-largest streamer globally with its 22K+ titles  —  EXCLUSIVE: As its stock price continues to languish, Cinedigm is following through on its stated plan to rebrand the company …

item.title: 情報筋の話：Politico, The New York Times, and other outlets plan to sit out the GOP presidential primary debates due to the cost and potential for brand damage (Max Tani/Semafor).
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Sources: Politico, The New York Times, and other outlets plan to sit out the GOP presidential primary debates due to the cost and the potential for brand damage  —  The Scoop  —  Some major media outlets have decided to sit out the Republican presidential primary debates.

item.title: ジェフ・シェルが解雇された後、NBCUを引き継いだコムキャスト社長マイク・カヴァナーのプロフィール。リンダ・ヤッカリーノの退社、作家のストライキなどに対処している（Benjamin Mullin/New York Times）
item.description:
Benjamin Mullin / New York Times:
A profile of Comcast president Mike Cavanagh, who took over NBCU after Jeff Shell was fired, as he deals with Linda Yaccarino's exit, writers' strike, and more  —  Mike Cavanagh, a veteran of the financial crisis, has just been given a leading part in the unending drama of Hollywood.
